dict.key: C01: The Japanese Sound System and Hiragana
ありがとう ございます。
あれは にほんごで なんと いいますか。
dict.string: How do you say that (over there) in Japanese?
Please say it. / Repeat after me.
dict.key: おおきい こえで おねがいします。
おおきい こえで いってください。
おはよう ございます。
これは にほんごで なんと いいますか。
dict.string: How do you say this in Japanese?
See you later. (literally, Well then, again.)
dict.key: それは にほんごで なんと いいますか。
dict.string: How do you say that in Japanese?
dict.key: 〜と いいます。／〜って いいます。
はじめまして。〜です。どうぞ よろしく。
dict.string: How do you do? I am ~. Pleased to meet you.
dict.key: 〜は にほんごで なんと いいますか。
dict.string: How do you say ~ in Japanese?
dict.key: もう いちど いってください。
もう いちど おねがいします。
もう すこし ゆっくり おねがいします。
アジアけんきゅう [アジア研究]
dict.string: freshman, first-year student (The suffix せい may be dropped.)
junior, third-year student (The suffix せい may be dropped.)
one's native country, hometown, birthplace, alma mater
dict.key: だいがくいんせい [大学院生]
dict.string: sophomore, second-year student (The suffix せい may be dropped.)
senior, fourth-year student (The suffix せい may be dropped.)
dict.key: りゅうがくせい [留学生]

dict.string: I (used by both males and females)
where (more polite than どこ), which way
polite prefix (e.g. おなまえ polite form of なまえ (name)
language (e.g. にほんご Japanese language)
-student (e.g. だいがくせい college student, いちねんせい freshman)
year (e.g. いちねん first year)
no, don't mention it, you're welcome

dict.key: いいえ、そうじゃありません／そうじゃないです
dict.string: It is I who should be saying that. Thank you.
colloquail version of 〜と いいます

dict.key: でんわばんご [電話番号]

dict.string: (to) be held, (to) have; the dictionary form is ある.
(to) go; the dictionary form is いく.
(to) return; (to) go home; the dictionary form is かえる.
(to) drink; the dictionary form is のむ.
(to) take (a bath), (to) enter; the dictionary form is はいる. おふろに はいります take a bath
(to) read; the dictionary form is よむ.
(to) take (a shower) シャワーを あびます take a shower; the dictionary form is あびる.
(to) get up, (to) wake up; the dictionary form is おきる.
(to) eat; the dictionary form is たべる.
(to) go to bed; the dictionary form is ねる.
(to) see, (to) watch; the dictionary form is みる.
(to) come; the dictionary form is くる.
(to) do; the dictionary form is する.
dict.key: べんきょうします [勉強します]
dict.string: (to) study; the dictionary form is べんきょうする.
not at all (used with negative verb forms)
1) at; on; in (point in time); e.g. 10じに ねます; 2) to (goal, activity) クラスに いきます
at; in; on; etc. (location of action or event); e.g. としょかんで べんきょうします
to (direction); e.g. がっこうへ いきます
direct object marker, e.g. ほんを よみます
this こんしゅう、こんばん
every まいしゅう、まいあさ、まいばん、まいにち

dict.key: ゆうびんきょく [郵便局]

dict.string: to be; to exist (used for animate beings).
there, that place (close to the listener or slightly removed from both speaker and listener)
that object, that (close to the lister or slightly removed from both speaker and listener)
over there, that place (far away from both speaker and listener)
very (always used with a negative form)
very (always used with an affirmative form)
very, e.g. どうも ありがとう Thank you very much, どうも すみません I'm very sorry
in front of, in the front
next to, at the side of
school cafeteria (a shortened form of 学生しょくどう)
dict.key: がくせいかいかん [学生会館]

dict.string: to take (time), it costs; the dictionary form is かかる.

dict.key: あがってください [あがって下さい]
おじゃまします [お邪魔します]
dict.string: Thank you. (literally: I will intrude on you.) (said before going inside someone's house or apartment)
dict.key: ごめんください [御免下さい]
どのぐらい／どのくらい
dict.string: how long, how much, how many
exercises うんどう（を）します to exercise (を is commonly deleted)
walk, stroll さんぽ（を）します to take a walk
question しつもん（を）します (to) ask a question
tennis テニスを します to play tennis
cooking, cuisine; e.g. りょうり（を）します to fix a meal
(to) meet; the dictionary form is あう.
(to) play; the dictionary form is あそぶ.
(to) walk, 〜まで あるきます (to) walk (up) towards; the dictionary form is あるく.
(to) say; the dictionary form is いう.
(to) swim; the dictionary form is およぐ.
(to) write; the dictionary form is かく.
dict.key: ききます [聞きます／聴きます]
dict.string: (to) ask (聞きます), (to) listen to (聴きます); the dictionary form is きく.
(to) talk; the dictionary form is はなす.
(to) wait; the dictionary form is まつ.
(to) call (someone), (to) invite; the dictionary form is よぶ.
(to) make (a phone call); the dictionary form is かける. e.g. でんわを かけます
dict.key: でかけます [出かけます]
dict.string: (to) go out; the dictionary form is でかける.

dict.key: やさしい [易しい、優しい]
だいじょうぶ（な） [大丈夫（な）]

dict.string: By all means. / I'd love to.
slowly, ゆっくりします, to relax, to take it easy
1) in order to, for (purpose); 2) to (goal, receiver)

dict.key: ちょっと つごうが わるくて [ちょっと都合が悪くて]
dict.string: I'm a little busy. (literally: Sorry, it's a little inconvenient.)
dict.key: ちょっと ようじが あって [ちょっと用事があって]
dict.string: Sorry, I have some errands/business to attend to.
dining しょくじする dine
basketball (abbreviated as バスケット or バスケ)
traveling りょこうする to travel
(for something) to end えいがが おわる the movie is over.
to take (a photograph) しゃしんを とる
(for something) to begin じゅぎょうが はじまる the class begins
and (when listing examples) おちゃや コーヒー tea, coffee, and so on
very much, 大すき like very much

dict.key: すきでもきらいでもありません [好きでも嫌いでもありません]
dict.string: I neither like nor dislike it.

dict.key: アクセサリーうりば [アクセサリー売り場]
しょくひんうりば [食品売り場]
しんしふくうりば [紳士服売り場]
dict.string: basement, e.g. ちかいっかい B1
dict.key: ふじんふくうりば [婦人服売り場]
ぶんぼうぐうりば [文房具売り場]

dict.string: to take (取る is a general equivalent for "to take", but 撮る is used when one takes a picture, records a video, or makes a copy.)
to put, e.g. はこに いれる to put in a box
a little, a few (more casual than すこし)
dict.key: もう すこし [もう少し]

dict.string: counter for floors of a building
counter for fish and small four-legged animals
counter for long, cylindrical objects (e.g., bottles, films, pens, pencil)
counter for thin objects (e.g., film, paper, plates, shirts)
counter for bound objects (e.g., books, magazines)
Do you have ~? Do you carry ~? (literally: Isn't there ~?)
dict.key: やさしいことばでいってください [やさしい言葉で言って下さい]
dict.string: Please say it in easier words
oil, e.g. あぶらが おおい fatty, oily
Italy, e.g. イタリアりょうり Italian cuisine
lunch, lunch set; e.g. Aランチ lunch set A
Japanese curry and rice dish (abbreviation: カレー)
sashimi (fillet of fresh raw fish, usually preceded by お)
a Western-style fixed menu, e.g. ハンバーガーセット hamburger set
dict.key: ちゅうかりょうり [中華料理]
dict.string: order, e.g. ちゅうもんする to order
a Japanese or Asian-style dish set, e.g. さしみていしょく sashimi set
dict.key: てんぷら [天ぷら／天麩羅]
dict.string: tempura (fish, shrimp, and vegetables battered and deep-fried)
rice (ライス is served on a plate, not in a bowl. ごはん is a generic term for cooked rice.)
Japanese cuisine (also 日本りょうり)
to need something (e.g. ソースがいる It needs sauce.)
low, e.g. カロリーがひくい low in calories
polite prefix, e.g. ごちゅうもん

dict.key: 〜を おねがいします [〜をお願いします]

dict.string: head, あたまがいい smalt, intelligent
dict.key: おじいさん [お祖父さん]
おばあさん [お祖母さん]
dict.string: female, おんなのひと woman
marriage, 〜とけっこんする to marry ~, けっこんしている to be married
child, おとこのこ boy, おんなのこ girl
back (part of the body), height (of a person)
age; としうえ elder, older; としした younger
to put on (a hat or cap)
to reside, 〜にすんでいる to live in ~
to put on (skirt, pants, socks, shoes)
to gain weight, ふとっている to be fat
to become employed; 〜につとめている to be employed, work for
to lose weight, やせている to be thin
How old ~? おいくつ (polite form)
elementary, e.g. 小学生 elementary school student, 小学校 elementary school
middle, e.g. 中学生 middle school student, 中学校 middle school, junior high school
person (polite form of 人), e.g. いいかた (nice person)

dict.key: いいえ、そんなことはありません。
dict.string: No, I still have a long way to go.

dict.key: てんきよほう [天気予報]

dict.string: to come to know; しっている to know, しらない don't know

dict.key: あたたかい [暖かい／温かい]
dict.string: warm; 暖かい (air temperature), 温かい (other objects such as water, food, heart, etc)
hot; 暑い (air temperature), 熱い (other objects such as water, food, heart, etc.)
after, e.g. あめのちはれ sunny after rain
dict.key: ほんとう（に）／ほんと（に） [本当（に）]
dict.string: truly, really, indeed; ほんと（に）is more conversational than ほんとう（に）
semester, quarter, e.g. いちがっき one semester, はるがっき spring semester/quarter
fight, quarrel けんかをする to fight
the New Year (often used with the polite prefix お, おしょうがつ）
junior high school (shortened form of 中学校)
dating, デートする go out on a date
Buddhist temple (often used as おてら)
when, at the time of ~ (子供の時 when I was a child)
festival (often used as おまつり)
to get on, to ride (ひこうきにのる get on a plane)

dict.key: しつれんする [失恋する]

dict.string: A particle of exclamation to express desires or feelings without addressing anyone in particular. Used in casual speech.
from ~, after ~ (e.g. 三年ご three years from now)
specific year (e.g. 1996年), counter for year (十年)
~ ago (e.g. 一年まえ one year ago)

dict.key: あけましておめでとうございます。 [明けましておめでとうございます。]
